--- title: Metrics keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Metrics and norms" ---
{% raw %}

Norms¶

Scipy doesnt have implementations for these norms

sparse_norm[source]

sparse_norm(A, ord=2)

Like scipy.sparse.lingalg.norm but with 2 and max norm implemented

sparse_2norm[source]

sparse_2norm(A)

Returns the matrix 2-norm of a sparse matrix A

sparse_maxnorm[source]

sparse_maxnorm(A)

Returns the max |A_ij| for a sparse matrix A

Metrics¶

The Laplacian distance isnt a real metric but ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

laplacian_distance[source]

laplacian_distance(G, Gp, setdiag=False)

Calculates $|| \mathcal{L} - \mathcal{L}_p ||$ using the matrix 2-norm

Line distances¶

This is used to calculate the distance between edges. The distances are cached

class LineDistances[source]

LineDistances(G, precompute=False)

class LineDistancesDataset[source]

LineDistancesDataset(G, dataset) :: LineDistances

Degree¶

average_gmdegree[source]

average_gmdegree(G, edges)

The average edge degree geometric mean over all edges in edges

edge_degree_gm[source]

edge_degree_gm(G, edge)

For an edge (u, v) with degree du, dv this function returns the geometric mean of du and dv
